info.title: MEM Microsoft Intune Connector
info.description: The Microsoft Intune connector helps to automate Microsoft Intune

get.description: Get a device by managed device id

Get_managedDeviceResponse.title: managedDevice
Get_managedDeviceResponse.description: Devices that are managed or pre-enrolled through Intune

lastUpdatedDateTime.description: Time the action state was last updated

complianceGracePeriodExpirationDateTime.description: The DateTime when device compliance grace period expires

userId.description: Unique Identifier for the user associated with the device

lastSyncDateTime.description: The date and time that the device last completed a successful sync with Intune.

osVersion.description: Operating system version of the device.

emailAddress.description: Email(s) for the user associated with the device

easActivationDateTime.description: Exchange ActivationSync activation time of the device.

operatingSystem.description: Operating system of the device. Windows, iOS, etc.

easActivated.description: Whether the device is Exchange ActiveSync activated.

secureBoot.description: When Secure Boot is enabled, the core components must have the correct cryptographic signatures

windowsPE.description: Operating system running with limited services that is used to prepare a computer for Windows

bitLockerStatus.description: On or Off of BitLocker Drive Encryption

tpmVersion.description: The security version number of the Boot Application

codeIntegrityCheckVersion.description: The version of the Boot Manager

bootDebugging.description: When bootDebugging is enabled, the device is used in development and testing

attestationIdentityKey.description: TWhen an Attestation Identity Key (AIK) is present on a device, it indicates that the device has an endorsement key (EK) certificate.

codeIntegrityPolicy.description: The Code Integrity policy that is controlling the security of the boot environment

bootRevisionListInfo.description: The Boot Revision List that was loaded during initial boot on the attested device

lastUpdateDateTime.description: The Timestamp of the last update.

virtualSecureMode.description: VSM is a container that protects high value assets from a compromised kernel

testSigning.description: When test signing is allowed, the device does not enforce signature validation during boot

earlyLaunchAntiMalwareDriverProtection.description: ELAM provides protection for the computers in your network when they start up

dataExcutionPolicy.description: DEP Policy defines a set of hardware and software technologies that perform additional checks on memory

healthAttestationSupportedStatus.description: This attribute indicates if DHA is supported for the device

operatingSystemRevListInfo.description: The Operating System Revision List that was loaded during initial boot on the attested device

issuedDateTime.description: The DateTime when device was evaluated or issued to MDM

healthStatusMismatchInfo.description: This attribute appears if DHA-Service detects an integrity issue

bootManagerSecurityVersion.description: The security version number of the Boot Application

codeIntegrity.description: When code integrity is enabled, code execution is restricted to integrity verified code

safeMode.description: Safe mode is a troubleshooting option for Windows that starts your computer in a limited state

resetCount.description: The number of times a PC device has hibernated or resumed

bootAppSecurityVersion.description: The security version number of the Boot Application

pcrHashAlgorithm.description: Informational attribute that identifies the HASH algorithm that was used by TPM

restartCount.description: The number of times a PC device has rebooted

pcr0.description: The measurement that is captured in PCR[0]

secureBootConfigurationPolicyFingerPrint.description: Fingerprint of the Custom Secure Boot Configuration Policy

bootManagerVersion.description: The version of the Boot Manager

operatingSystemKernelDebugging.description: When operatingSystemKernelDebugging is enabled, the device is used in development and testing

easDeviceId.description: Exchange ActiveSync Id of the device.

azureADDeviceId.description: The unique identifier for the Azure Active Directory device. Read only.

managedDeviceName.description: Automatically generated name to identify a device. Can be overwritten to a user friendly name.

exchangeLastSuccessfulSyncDateTime.description: Last time the device contacted Exchange.

azureADRegistered.description: Whether the device is Azure Active Directory registered.

activationLockBypassCode.description: Code that allows the Activation Lock on a device to be bypassed.

remoteAssistanceSessionErrorDetails.description: An error string that identifies issues when creating Remote Assistance session objects.

compliancePolicy.description: Whether compliance policy is managed by Intune

resourceAccess.description: Whether resource access is managed by Intune

inventory.description: Whether inventory is managed by Intune

windowsUpdateForBusiness.description: Whether Windows Update for Business is managed by Intune

deviceConfiguration.description: Whether device configuration is managed by Intune

modernApps.description: Whether modern application is managed by Intune

remoteAssistanceSessionUrl.description: Url that allows a Remote Assistance session to be established with the device.

jailBroken.description: whether the device is jail broken or rooted.
